data.text:
Saving lives and property by exceeding expectations

Reeves County Emergency Service Districts No. 1 and No. 2 (RCESD) is a team of men and women who serve and protect the communities of Reeves County by providing Fire and Emergency Medical Services.

Notice About Tax Rates and Truth in Taxation Worksheet â€“ ESD 1

RCESD 1 Notice about Tax Rates 2024

Notice about tax rates 2024

ESD 1 Truth in Taxation Worksheet

COMMUNITY Outreach

A goal of the Districts is to create a partnership with the community meant to create and improve civic engagement.

Commissioners & GOVERNING BOARD

A Board of five commissioners governs each ESD. These Commissioners are appointed to two-year terms by the County Commissioners Court. The ESD Board of Commissioners is the source of authority and governance for each District and has final say over all matters affecting the ESD.

Employees & Volunteers

Employee Volunteer Programs are an effective vehicle for enhancing the Districtsâ€™ climate.

NEWS & UPDATES

Air Medical Memberships

Reeves County Emergency Service District No. 2 purchased AirMedCare air ambulance memberships for all residents and transient workforce of Reeves County. Memberships will cover these individuals for all medically necessary air ambulanceâ€¦

Reeves County Emergency Service Districts Nos. 1 & 2

The professional & volunteer firefighters and paramedics of RCESD Nos. 1 & 2 are a team that helps protect the communities of Reeves County by responding to fires, hazardous incidents and medical emergencies at a moment's notice. 24/7/365

**PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT** Reeves County ESD will be conducting important training exercises at the old ISD field house facility located on west Jackson St. this weekend. The drills will begin on Saturday morning, August 10th, and will continue through Sunday evening. Please note that the exercises will involve the use of artificial smoke and other training equipment. These activities are strictly for training purposes, and there is no cause for public concern. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation as we work to enhance our emergency response capabilities. â€¦ See MoreSee Less

The Importance of Audible Fire Alarm Systems in Businesses Dear Community, Ensuring our safety is a shared responsibility. Audible fire alarm systems play a crucial role in this effort. Here's why they matter and why you should always acknowledge them: 1. Early Detection: Audible alarms provide quick warning, allowing for timely evacuation and saving lives. 2. Minimizing Damage: Immediate response can significantly reduce property loss and damage. 3. Clear Alerts: Audible alarms ensure everyone hears and understands the need to evacuate. Ignoring or turning off audible fire alarms can lead to: â€“ Delayed Evacuation: Risking lives and increasing injuries. â€“ Greater Property Damage: Delayed response can lead to more extensive damage. Important: Never turn off the alarms until the fire department arrives and gives the all-clear. Turning them off prematurely can cause confusion and put everyone at risk. Business owners, ensure your audible fire alarm systems are regularly inspected and maintained. Employees and customers, always respond immediately to alarms. For more information or assistance please reach out to us. Stay safe, Reeves County Emergency Services District 1 & 2 â€¦ See MoreSee Less
